TwoPhase¶

class mimpy.models.twophase.TwoPhase[source]¶

Model class for solving two-phase, immiscible, slightly compressible flow problem based on the Mimetic Finite Difference method.

add_pressure_well(bhp, PI, cell_index, well_name)[source]¶

Adds rate specified point source at the center of cell_index. Returns the index of the new rate well. Injection rate is in m^3/second

add_rate_well(injection_rate_water, injection_rate_oil, cell_index, well_name)[source]¶

Adds rate specified point source at the center of cell_index. Returns the index of the new rate well. Injection rate is in m^3/second

apply_flux_boundary_from_function(boundary_marker, f_function)[source]¶

Applies static flux (neumann) boundary conditions from function.

apply_pressure_boundary_from_function(boundary_marker, p_function)[source]¶

Applies static pressure (dirichlet) boundary conditions from function.

find_upwinding_direction()[source]¶

Computes the upwinding direction for each face in the mesh.

get_well_rate_oil(well_index)[source]¶

Returns the oil production rate for well_index

get_well_rate_water(well_index)[source]¶

Returns the water production rate for well_index

initialize_system()[source]¶

Constructs the initial matrices used to construct the saddle-point problem.

oil_mobility(water_saturation, oil_pressure)[source]¶

Returns oil mobility.

reset_wells()[source]¶

Removes all wells.

sefromsw(water_saturation)[source]¶

Computes scaled saturation value se => [0, 1] from physical water saturation.

set_cell_porosity(cell_index, porosity)[source]¶

Sets porosity for cell_index.

set_cell_s_w(cell_index, s_w)[source]¶

Sets water saturation for cell_index.

set_compressibility_oil(compressibility_oil)[source]¶

Sets oil compressilibity.

set_compressibility_water(compressibility_water)[source]¶

Sets water compressilibity.

set_corey_relperm(n_o, n_w, k_rw_o=1.0)[source]¶

Sets a Corey-type relative permeability function.

set_initial_p_o(p_o)[source]¶

Sets the pressure distributionat time 0.

set_initial_s_w(s_w)[source]¶

Sets initial water saturation.

set_initial_u_t(u_t)[source]¶

Sets initial total velocity for system.

set_kro(kro)[source]¶

Set oil relative permeability function.

set_krw(krw)[source]¶

Set water relative permeability function.

set_mesh(mesh)[source]¶

Sets the computational mesh to be used.

set_model_name(name)[source]¶

Sets model name used for output.

set_number_of_time_steps(number_of_time_steps)[source]¶

Set number of time steps taken.

set_output_frequency(frequency)[source]¶

Sets how often to output the solution by iteration number. x

set_porosities(porosities)[source]¶

Sets cell porosities.

set_ref_density_oil(ref_density_oil)[source]¶

Sets reference density of oil at reference pressure.

set_ref_density_water(ref_density_water)[source]¶

Sets reference density of water at reference presssure.

set_ref_pressure_oil(ref_pressure_oil)[source]¶

Set reference pressure for oil.

set_ref_pressure_water(ref_pressure_water)[source]¶

Set reference pressure for water.

set_residual_saturation_oil(residual_saturation_oil)[source]¶

Sets oil residual saturation.

set_residual_saturation_water(residual_saturation_water)[source]¶

Sets water residual saturation.

set_saturation_boundaries(boundary_marker, saturation_function)[source]¶

Sets the saturation boundaries for pressure specified (Dirichlet) boundaries.

set_saturation_substeps(number_of_saturation_substeps)[source]¶

Sets the number of saturation steps to take between regular pressure time step intervals. The default is 1, meaning take one saturation step for each pressure step.

set_solver(tag)[source]¶

Sets the solution method.

Parameters:tag (str) – Indicates which solver to use: - “default” => uses spsolve from scipy. - “PETSc” => uses the petsc4py library
Returns:None
set_time_step_size(delta_t)[source]¶

Sets time step size.

set_viscosity_oil(viscosity_oil)[source]¶

Set oil viscosity.

set_viscosity_water(viscosity_water)[source]¶

Set water viscosity.

start_solving()[source]¶

Starts solving the problem. The two-phase system solves for p_o and s_w. Using IMPES, we start by solving the pressure system using the update_ pressure routine. After that, the saturations are updated explicitly.

time_step_output(current_time, time_step)[source]¶

Function to be defined by user that will be run at each output interval during time-stepping. The function is intended for complex output.

update_pressure(time_step)[source]¶

Solve the pressure system for p_o. self.current_p_o and self.current_u_t are considered the pressure and velocity at time n, and routine computes these quantities for time n+1.

update_saturation(time_step)[source]¶

Updates water satuation based on the current p_o and u_t.

water_mobility(water_saturation, water_pressure)[source]¶

Returns water mobility
